intro: Ouratea nutans, commonly known as the drooping ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pendulous inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in clusters, giving the plant a delicate and ornamental appearance.
